name: Short Foot (Arch Raise)
setup: Stand barefoot or in socks near a wall/chair for light support
Feet hip-width, weight centered over mid-foot
Keep big toe pads in contact with the floor
steps: Gently draw the ball of the foot toward the heel to lift the arch
Keep all toes relaxed on the ground—avoid curling
Hold the arch lift for 2–3 seconds, then slowly relax
Maintain even pressure through big toe and mid-foot
mistakes: Curling the toes instead of lifting the arch
Shifting weight to the outside edge of the foot
safety: Keep effort gentle and pain-free. Stop if sharp pain occurs in the lateral foot or arch.

regressions: Seated short foot with partial weight
Two-foot balance with minimal arch lift
progressions: Add small heel raise while maintaining arch

variations: Toe yoga (lift big toe while others down, then switch)
Arch lift with towel feedback under arch

prescriptionHints.notes: Prioritize quality over range; small motion is effective

joints.notes: Keep big toe engaged and ankle stacked to avoid rolling outward
